intro: Kirganelia zanzibariensis, commonly known as the Zanzibar star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the shores, thriving in coastal environments. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is also considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
